title: Roberts invited to testify at Senate hearing on Supreme Court ethics
description: The invitation to attend a Senate judiciary hearing comes amid reports that Justice Clarence Thomas did not disclose luxury trips.

title: Charge against Alec Baldwin in the 'Rust' movie set shooting will be dropped
description: Prosecutors in New Mexico plan to drop an involuntary manslaughter charge against Alec Baldwin in the fatal 2021 shooting of Rust cinematographer Halyna Hutchins, Baldwin's attorneys said.

title: A former pro wrestler is charged in Mississippi with welfare fraud
description: Companies run by former professional wrestler Ted "Teddy" DiBiase Jr. received "sham contracts" in Mississippi and misspent millions of dollars of welfare money, according to a new federal indictment.

title: John Fetterman wants to "pay it forward" by speaking openly about his depression
description: The Pennsylvania freshman senator is back to work on Capitol Hill after admitting himself to a hospital to seek treatment for clinical depression in February.

title: After a whirlwind year, John Fetterman is back in the Senate
description: The senator was met with a standing ovation upon his return to the Democratic caucus.

title: BuzzFeed shutters its newsroom as the company undergoes layoffs
description: BuzzFeed News started in 2012 and grew to have more than 100 journalists across the world. Moving forward, BuzzFeed will concentrate news efforts in HuffPost, the company said.

title: McCarthy proposes changing access to food stamps as part of debt limit debate
description: McCarthy wants more people who receive food stamps to be subject to work reporting requirements. Advocates worry that shift, if passed, could mean people get shut out of the program

title: A massive search for 3 missing American sailors off Mexico coast has been called off
description: After scouring roughly 200,000 square miles with no sign of the three and their sailboat, the Mexican navy and U.S. Coast Guard have suspended the search. They've been missing for more than two weeks.

title: Think you're tired? This animal goes for months with only two hours of sleep a day
description: Scientists have learned that northern elephant seals — massive creatures found along the Pacific Coast of North America — cobble together a couple hours of sleep using underwater power naps.

title: Security comes first in U.S.-China economic relations, says Treasury Secretary Yellen
description: Still, U.S. and China need to work together on issues like climate change and debt relief.

title: A 4th arrest is made in a birthday party shooting in Alabama
description: A fourth suspect was arrested Thursday and charged with murder in connection with a shooting at a Sweet 16 birthday party that killed four young people in Alabama, authorities announced.

title: How the AR-15 became the bestselling rifle in the U.S.
description: Washington Post reporter Todd Frankel explains how the AR-15 was adapted from the M16 military combat automatic rifle, and how it became an icon of gun culture and a favored weapon for mass shooters.

title: The U.S. plans new protections for old forests facing pressure from climate change
description: The Biden administration catalogued 175,000 square miles of old growth and mature forests on federal land. It plans a new rule to better protect woodlands from fires and other climate change effects.

title: A suspect is wanted for shooting a 6-year-old after a basketball rolled into his yard
description: Authorities are looking for the North Carolina man they say shot a kindergartner and three others. It's the fourth high-profile incident this week in which apparent mistakes were met with gunshots.

title: An overlooked brain system helps you grab a coffee – and plan your next cup
description: Researchers have found a system in the brain that seems to integrate control of individual muscles with a person's intentions, emotions, and entire body.

title: Filming on Alec Baldwin's movie 'Rust' is shifting to Montana
description: Filming is set to resume this week in Montana, in the aftermath of the fatal shooting of a cinematographer during a rehearsal with actor Alec Baldwin on the original production in New Mexico in 2021.

title: 'Greek Lessons' is an intimate, vulnerable portrayal of two lonely people
description: Greek Lessons feels like a departure from Han Kang's other English-translated novels; tugging bit by bit at the heartstrings, readers are left speechless with both sadness and hope by the final pages.

title: Khartoum's hospital system has collapsed after cease-fire fails
description: After close to two weeks of fighting and a failed attempt at an internationally-brokered cease-fire, most of its hospitals are shut down and inaccessible.

title: Ukraine refugees face uncertainty and precarity as displacement persists
description: Despite being welcomed by European neighbors, for most Ukrainians, it's not enough to build a new life. Many are caught in a cycle of repeated uprooting, displacement and return.

title: A feral cat-hunting contest for kids in New Zealand is scrapped after a backlash
description: The competition withdrew its new category after pushback from animal rights groups. The controversy highlights a broader debate over how to manage the invasive species.

title: How melting Arctic ice could be fueling extreme wildfires in the Western U.S.
description: As Western wildfires get more destructive, scientists are finding a far-off connection to shrinking ice on the Arctic Ocean.

title: Biden promised a watchdog for opioid settlement billions, but feds are quiet so far
description: Billions of dollars are headed to state and local governments to address the opioid crisis. If the federal government fails to oversee how the money is spent, advocates worry it will be wasted.

title: One reason the push for diversity in medicine is lagging
description: The U.S. desperately needs more Black and Hispanic doctors, research shows. But financial pressures and discrimination can keep young people from even applying to med school.

title: The K-pop star Moon Bin is found dead at his home at the age of 25
description: Police are investigating the death of the singer for the boy band Astro, but have so far found no signs of foul play, according to South Korea's Yonhap news agency.

title: Facebook users can apply for their portion of a $725 million lawsuit settlement
description: The settlement stems from a lawsuit alleging Facebook developers sold user data to Cambridge Analytica, a former political consulting firm, to target people in the 2016 U.S. presidential election.

title: Viewers in parts of Australia and Indonesia saw this rare hybrid solar eclipse
description: Under a cloudless sky, about 20,000 eclipse chasers watched a rare solar eclipse plunge part of Australia's northwest coast into brief midday darkness Thursday with an accompanying temperature drop.

title: SpaceX will try to launch its Starship rocket again on Thursday
description: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has said the Starship rocket is intended to transport people to the Moon and Mars.

title: Stampede in Yemen at Ramadan charity event kills at least 78
description: The tragedy was Yemen's deadliest in years that was not related to the country's long-running war, and came ahead of the Muslim holiday of Eid al-Fitr, which later this week marks the end of Ramadan.

title: Why millions of kids aren't getting their routine vaccinations
description: COVID-19 disrupted health care across the globe. causing the biggest drop in childhood vaccination rates in decades. UNICEF's latest estimates find that nearly 50 million children entirely missed out.
